titleStmt.title: A briefe and familiar epistle shevving His Maiesties most lawfull, honourable and iust title to all his kingdomes VVith an epitaph or briefe lamentation for the late Maiestie Royall of most famous, godly, and honourable memory: with a reioycing after sorrow for the same. And lastly a prayer for his Maiesties most happy succession, and for the Queene and their children. By Robert Fletcher.
titleStmt.author: Fletcher, Robert, purveyor of carriages to Queen Elizabeth.

titleStmt.title: A briefe and familiar epistle shevving His Maiesties most lawfull, honourable and iust title to all his kingdomes VVith an epitaph or briefe lamentation for the late Maiestie Royall of most famous, godly, and honourable memory: with a reioycing after sorrow for the same. And lastly a prayer for his Maiesties most happy succession, and for the Queene and their children. By Robert Fletcher.
titleStmt.author: Fletcher, Robert, purveyor of carriages to Queen Elizabeth.

publicationStmt.publisher: [By R. Read] for Iohn Harrison [2], dwelling in Pater-noster rowe, at the signe of the Anchor,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
